comments.raw_text:
Opening the Add-on Manager now opens as a new tab instead of a window as it used to in 2.0.X. First, I think this is awkward since you normally don't expect a new tab for system settings (e.g., Preferences), especially if you don't normally use tabs. Second, this should probably, as a minimum, honor Preferences/Browser/Link Behavior so it's not confusing to users that don't use tabs.

I think the Add-on Manager window should look very distinct and not show in a regular browser window or tab to reduce the risk of drive-by downloads.

It's entirely possible it was at an early stage of the development but it's always been a goal to make it fully usable in a window for apps where a tab just doesn't make sense. Now granted we don't run it in a window in Firefox so it's possible there is breakage there I'm not aware of, but we do run pretty much all the add-ons manager UI tests in both tabbed and windowed mode so I believe it should be working.
